importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The planned opening date of the exhibition at CajaGranada Cultural Center in Granada, where the Picasso painting was meant to be displayed.
The day before the exhibition was set to open, when the delivery van arrived at the cultural center and the delivery process began.
The date when the disappearance was reported to police and when the official investigation was confirmed.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time when unpacking of the artworks began, during which the missing Picasso painting was not found.
The period when staff completed unpacking and positioned the artworks in the exhibition hall, during which the painting went missing.

keyTakeAways: A Picasso painting, 'Still Life with Guitar' (1919), vanished during its transport to a temporary exhibition in Granada, Spain.
The painting was insured for 600,000 euros ($700,000), indicating high value and significance.
The delivery was under video surveillance and all security protocols were followed, yet the painting disappeared.
Spanish police have launched an investigation and have added the artwork to the international database of stolen artworks.
Historically, Picasso’s paintings have been frequent targets of theft, with recoveries from 2019 to 2024 demonstrating a pattern of high-profile art thefts.
No incidents were observed in the video footage over the weekend, suggesting the theft may have occurred during or immediately after unpacking.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 1919 gouache painting by Pablo Picasso titled 'Still Life with Guitar' vanished during its delivery to a temporary exhibition at the CajaGranada Cultural Center in Granada, Spain. The painting, valued at 600,000 euros, was insured and delivered under video surveillance, with all security protocols followed. Despite no incidents being recorded over the weekend, the painting was missing by mid-morning on Monday, October 13. Spanish police have launched an investigation and have added the artwork to the international database of stolen artworks. The incident follows a pattern of Picasso paintings being targeted by thieves, with several high-profile recoveries in recent years, including in 2019, 2021, and 2023, indicating a persistent threat to valuable art collections.
title: Picasso painting goes missing en route to exhibition
